@srkukarni I know, I was waiting on counter support, but if that's not required for API completion then I can resume work on this.

I consider Counters as advanced features that allows us to do stateful functions, but without them stateless functions are still possible. I dont want to stall that part of documentation before we implement the stateful stuff
On the list for today.
@sijie @mgodave This is NOT ready for review, and work on this can really only continue when the schema registry is integrated with the clients.
we should leave counter/state part out of the scope of 2.0. let's finish the documentation for stateless part, we need finish the documentation for 2.0 by end of this week.

@merlimat
closing for #1645
what is the reason for hiding this command?

In 2.0 the concept of cluster in a topic name goes away. Plus I believe we(and the rest of the industry) have standardized on the keyword topic. The hiding is to make sure that legacy users still have access to the old way.

> what is the reason for hiding this command?

`pulsar-admin namespaces destinations $MY_NAMESPACE` 
was converted into `pulsar-admin namespaces topics $MY_NAMESPACE`. 

Initially, I used an alias in JCommander, but that doesn't really work (and also leaves `topics(destinations)` in the help text which is confusing.

Documentation will refer only to the preferred way, but old command will still work.

@merlimat One thing to note is that java.time.Clock doesn't support nanoTime. I don't need it for now, but if we want nanoTime and currentTimeMillis to move in tandem in a test, this will need to be revisited
Raised a separate issue on the documentation, this one is solved.
